text: Miss Philippines Earth 2011, the 11th edition of the advocacy-driven Miss Philippines Earth beauty pageant, was held on 5 June 2011 in Puerto Princesa, Palawan, Philippines with 10 finalists competed in the finale and was telecast on ABS-CBN at 10:00 pm and The Filipino Channel and was shown internationally via The Filipino Channel. The pageant had aligned itself with the "International Year of the Forests" as it centered this year's pageant edition with the promotion of forests conservation. Miss Philippines Earth 2010 winner Kris Psyche Resus crowned Athena Mae Imperial from Casiguran, Aurora as her successor. Imperial represented the Philippines in the international Miss Earth 2011 beauty pageant and won Miss Earth Water 2011. Aside from the Miss Philippines Earth 2011 grand title, four other titles of equal importance and with the same rank were crowned. Tarhata Clio Shari Rico was crowned Miss Philippines Eco Tourism 2011, Michelle Gavagan won Miss Philippines Fire 2011, Murielle Adrienne Orais received the Miss Philippines Water 2010, and Jonavi Raisa Quiray was crowned Miss Philippines Air 2011. ==Results== ;Color keys {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size: 90%;" !width="230" style="background-color:#787878;color:#FFFFFF;"|Final Results !width="350" style="background-color:#787878;color:#FFFFFF;"|Candidate !width="230" style="background-color:#787878;color:#FFFFFF;"|International Placement |- |style="background:#FFFF66;" | Miss Philippines Earth 2011 !style="background:#FFFF66;" | Casiguran, Aurora – Athena Mae Imperial !style="background:#FFFF66;" | Miss Earth – Water 2011 |- | Miss Philippines Air | Puerto Princesa City – Jonavi Raisa Quiray |- | Miss Philippines Water | Cebu City – Murielle Adrienne Orais |- | Miss Philippines Fire | Las Piñas City – Michelle Gavagan |- | Miss Philippines Eco Tourism (Resigned) | Makati City – Tarhata Clio Shari Rico |- | The Runners-up | * Malolos City – Mary Denisse Toribio (Assumed Eco-Tourism title) * Pagadian City – Maria Alicia Elena Ariosa * Cotabato City – Edan Dafilmoto * * Fil-US East Coast – Brenna Cassandra Gamboa * General Santos City – Cathrine Rosary Ocampo |- | Top 20 | * Balanga City, Bataan – Dindi Joy Pajares * Cagayan de Oro City – Catherine Marie Almirante * Calapan City, Oriental Mindoro – Mary Sheila Rosales * Imus, Cavite – Angela Patricia Medina * Loay, Bohol – Renee Soraya Hassani * City of Manila, Metro Manila – Margo Kathrine Midwinter * Narvacan, Ilocos Sur – Ralph Lauren Asuncion * San Fernando City, La Union – Erika Marie Syhongpan * San Juan City, Metro Manila – Ana Maria Baladad * Tanauan City, Batangas – Diane Carmela Querrer |} ===Special awards=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! There were eight candidates eliminated and forty remained in the contest. * The second elimination round took place on 12 May 2011. There were ten candidates eliminated and thirty remained in the contest. * The third elimination round took place on 16 May 2011. There were ten candidates eliminated and twenty remained in the contest. * The fourth elimination round took place on 21 May 2011. There were ten candidates eliminated and the top 10 finalists were chosen. ==Crossovers from Major National Pageants prior to this date== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! City/Town !! Details |- |Casiguran || Athena Mae Imperial was Mutya ng Pilipinas 2009 Top 12 semi-finalist. |- |Loboc ||Aileene Ella Dango was Mutya ng Pilipinas 2010 Top 10 semi-finalist. |- |Puerto Princesa City || Jonavi Raisa Quiray competed at Mutya ng Pilipinas 2008 and became Mutya ng Pilipinas International 2008. She also won the Miss ASEAN TV Charming 2010 contest on 22 March 2010 in Ho Chi Minh City, |- |San Juan City || Ana Maria Baladad was Mutya ng Pilipinas 2009 Overseas Communities |} ==Post-Pageant notes== * Miss Philippines Earth 2011 Athena Mae Imperial competed at Miss Earth 2011 on 3 Dec in Quezon City, Philippines and placed as Miss Earth Water (2nd runner-up) ==Delegates== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! City/Town !! Details |- |Baliuag|| Vivienne Andrea Gulla was a news anchor and reporter for Radio Philippines Network. |- |Bayugan|| Alyssa Mae Canizares won Mutya ng Bayugan 2009 and competed Bai Naliyagan 2009 (Miss Naliyagan 2009) where she won. Bai Naliyagan is a pageant in Agusan del Sur for the Naliyagan Festival held every June. She is the first delegate from Agusan del Sur joined in Miss Philippines Earth 2011. |- |Calapan City || Mary Sheila Rosales competed and won first runner up in the Miss Oriental Mindoro 2008 |- |Caloocan City || Clarize Angelica Barrameda won the Miss Caloocan City 2011 (Bb. Caloocan 2011) beauty pageant held at the Glorietta Park, Tala, Caloocan City, Philippines . |- |Cebu City || Muriel Adrienne Orais received the title for the nationwide search of the Olive C Campus Model Search 2010 in the Philippines. Prior to the national final, she also competed and won in the Miss Olive C Campus Model Cebu 2009 contest. |- |Cotabato City || Edan Annecia Merl Dafilmoto competed and won in the "Mutya ng Cotabato 2009" beauty pageant. |- |Las Piñas City || Michelle Gavagan competed and won Miss Southville International School and College 2010 in the Philippines. |- |Libungan || Crista Juanico competed and won Mutya ng Cotabato 2010 beauty pageant. |- |Lipa City || Czshevinah Hae Alejandro competed and won the Miss Lipa Tourism 2010. She was also Mutya ng Batangas 2010 2nd Runner-up. |- |Malolos City || Mary Denisse Toribio participated and won in the Lakambini ng Bulacan 2010 (Miss Bulacan 2010) beauty pageant held at Bulacan Capitol Gymnasium, Malolos, Bulacan, Philippines. |- |Milaor || Jaine Hidalgo won the Miss Kaogma 2010 beauty pageant during the annual celebration of the Kaogma Festival held in Camarines Sur, Philippines. |- |Narvacan || Ralph Lauren Asuncion competed and won Miss Night Camp 2007 and Make Me A Supermodel San Sebastian 2010 in San Sebastian College, Manila, Philippines. |- |Passi City || Diana Angelie Jainga competed in the Bb. Pintados de Pasi 2011 and won the title. In December 2009, she competed and bagged the title of Miss Iloilo Nursing 2009 organized by the Student Nurses Association of the Philippines (SNAP) – Iloilo Chapter held at the University of San Agustin, Iloilo, Philippines. She also won first runner up in the Miss Paraw Regatta 2009 beauty pageant. |- |Tanauan City|| Diane Carmela Querrer was a side court reporter in UAAP for the University of Santo Tomas during its 70th Season. |- |Vigan City || Diana Rose Santos won the Saniata ti Ilocos Sur Environment 2011 held in the Ilocos Sur province, Philippines. |- |Virac, Catanduanes || Anna Amalia Brillante won Bb.
